conclusion: Determine the gravitational force exerted by the remaining part of the sphere on the point mass m located at a distance of 2R from the center O.
Calculate the gravitational force exerted by the original sphere of radius R and mass M on the point mass m located at a distance of 2R.
The formula for the gravitational force between two masses M1 and M2 separated by a distance r is F = G * (M1 * M2) / r^2.
Find the mass of the smaller sphere that has been removed.
The volume of a sphere is V = (4/3) * pi * r^3.
Volume of original sphere V_original = (4/3) * pi * R^3.
Volume of smaller sphere V_small = (1/6) * pi * R^3.
Mass of the smaller sphere M_small = (1/8) * M.
Mass of the remaining part M_remaining = (7/8) * M.
Find the gravitational force exerted by the remaining part on the point mass m using the principle of superposition.
The remaining part consists of two parts: the part of the original sphere outside the smaller sphere and the part of the original sphere inside the smaller sphere.
Mass of the part outside the smaller sphere M_outside = (7/8) * M.
Mass of the part inside the smaller sphere M_inside = (1/8) * M.
Total gravitational force F = F_outside + F_inside = G * (M * m) / (4R^2).
Gravitational force F exerted by the remaining part on the particle is G * (M * m) / (4R^2).
